review: I've been on this for 2 months now and my blood pressure is still high.  I also take 25mg of Hydroch with it daily.  Doesn't work like Lisinopril but I can't take it due to the cough.   Now I will need to ween off Olmesartain because it's a dangerous drug to quit

Benicar (olmesartan):I have taking Benicar  HCTZ 40-25 FOR 15YRS The name has changed to the generic Olmesartan I wasn't happy with the name change because I don't know if it's the same medication, I assume it is. I've been taken Benicar along with Atenolol 100mg and those two combinations work great together, I never have or had any problems with this medication. I also don't have migraines like I use to. I have no complaints or problems with the medication, I actually like it, my Dr 15yrs ago put me on it and said this is what he prescribes his patients and if it's good enough for my Dr's parents it's good enough for me. No complaints. I see some of these reviews states they have feet pain, but if these people are diabetes the feet and muscle pain could come from neuropathy. My ins won't cover it.

This drug was awful for me. The day after my first dose I started getting a cold, headache and diarrhea.  I also had insomnia. The cold and the headache got worse every day. By the 3rd day my head felt like it was gonna explode! I could barely function. Not to mention I was only getting about 3 hours of sleep a night because of the insomnia. Shooting pains across the crown of my head that wrapped around to both temples. Sinus pressure up my nose and right above not eyebrows.  I took myself off it it before my 4th dose.  It did very little to control my bp. There has to be something better out there.

Was on valsartan generic made by Macleods Pharmaceuticals Limited. I tried olmesartan from the same company. REALLY had problems with both of these. The valsartan at 160 mg/day made me have fainting and my BP would go to 180 or so after days at 130. It was unpredictible. Finally got Olmesartan made by Accord at started with 20mg/day. This put my BP pretty low so I started with 15mg/day. Still working with this. Have had side effects of feeling weak with 20mg/day. I have tinnitus and the Valsartan did not help this at all. I firmly believe that the BP meds I have been taking started this. Hoping Olmesartan will be better.

Extremely bad experience after only 2 doses of non generic olmesartan. Am seeing my doctor tomorrow to change.  I went to see the chemist yesterday after work as I was concerned with the symptoms.  The chemist advised symptoms can hang around for a week or so.  After the first 20mg pill in the morning,  I woke at 2.30am & had leg aches. I took 2nd pill in the morning with breakfast & by the time I got to work my legs felt like lead. I had sharp pains down my legs. My hip bones felt like I was some arthritic 100 year old. I had difficulty walking. My head ached. I began to get forgetful to the point where it alarmed me. On coming home , even my husband noticed I was different.  Today I didn't take this drug which I'm now calling poison!! I still have bad lower back & hip ache despite not taking it today.  I would give this drug a big ZERO & feel I should be given a refund!

Benicar (olmesartan):Been on 20mg Benicar for decade (I am 72). Works great.  Took  cheaper generic made by Glenmark & developed bronchitis..   Do your research when switching to any generic. Look to see if there’s an authorized generic. If not, ask about other pharmaceutical companies that make generic. These companies can add fillers to the brand formula.  CVS Caremark  gave me three more suppliers they could get a generic from. An internet search for generic Olmesartan Medoximil (Benicar) along with the manufacturing company gave the ingredients used to compare to the Benicar-Brand produced by Sankyo. Accord Pharmaceuticals’  list of ingredients looks identical to Sankyo’s Brand Benicar. I’m hoping the Accord generic will work like Brand Benicar, as Accord cost is about $13/month. Much better than $2K for Sankyo-produced brand Benicar.  Hope this info helps.

I’m the type where I don’t get side effects from meds this one included. I was scared of the negative reviews, but my BP had been 160/100. Political and covid stress for over 6 months. I don’t drink, smoke, not overweight, don’t cook w salt, a little sedentary though. I haven’t taken my BP yet on this med, but I feel much better after my first dose. My heart isn’t pounding. Doc told me 2 things-make sure I drink lots of water and I may feel dizzy upon standing because this med opens (dilates) the blood vessels. I had the dizziness couple of times but that always happened before my BP was high. After we get back to semi normal I hope to be able to stop taking

I have been on olmesartan for about 2 months.  Started at 20mg. BP too low, very dizzy and nauseous. Then 15 mg, same problem.Now 10mg, BP very good.  Dizzy occasionally, but nauseous all the time. I see the cardiologist in a week and have to get off this drug.By the way, it was NOT the cardiologist that prescribed it.  It was the primary doctor.  My insurance covered this drug.  I’d rather pay something than have to feel rubbish all the time.

Started taking olmesartan 1 week ago and I know it takes time for some drugs to set in, but this drug has made me feel horrible.  The first day, I had no issues and it did seem to lower my BP that evening.  The next 4 days, the issues piled on.  The worst was the chest pain, chest tightness, insomnia, and pressure in my head.  I started off with 40 mg but quickly realized it was too much so cut it in half.  Even with half a pill, I continue to have symptoms.  I am slowly weaning it down to zero and getting off of this drug.  I feel worse now than I did before I took it.

Benicar (olmesartan):I was put on 20mg of Benicar January 2020.  After about 3 months , I started having a chronic choking cough, extreme fatigue, could barely walk a block without feeling fatigued.  Rapid heartbeat, dizziness,  stomach upset and low body temp.   The most troubling side effect was rapid weight gain - 30 lbs in 6 months.  Very debilitating year.

Took Verapamil for 10 years. BP was controlled but developed severe fatigue so Dr. switched to Olmesartan. First two weeks was okay but began to experience bad headaches and insomnia. After 3months, my BP is uncontrolled and glucose readings are higher. At next Dr appointment will be requesting new BP Rx. Olmesartan was ineffective for my BP.

Benicar (olmesartan):I am not overweight at all yet still developed HT at 50 years old.   I tried the gamut of BP meds all producing the desired results but all having the same varying side effects most often a dry cough.  Then I tried Benicar 20mg.  It lowered my BP, but, I was extremely lethargic.  Started to take it at night but then couldn't get up in the morning.  I cut my tablets into quarters and started taking 5mg instead of 20mg.  My BP remained fine at 5mg and I stayed at that does for 12 years without any side effects.  At 66 years old I switched to a vegetarian diet and within half a year my BP began to drop too low.  I reduced my dosage to 5mg every-other-day and my BP was still too low.  I stopped taking Benicar altogether and have not found it necessary to go back on it for nearly 18 months now.  I'm still learning to eat vegetarian and make things taste good but very pleased that I have been able to control HT through diet.  PS:  you should also know, I do 10k steps a day every day.

when I was 230lbs, I felt like Olmesartin was marginal at best. I would typically have readings of about 146 / 90. I've had a recent weight increase, and even with a Atenolol supplement, i'm at a dangerous level (180 / 100).I need to get off of this and find one that works.

Olmesartan keeps my  high blood pressure under control but causes me to suffer nasal passages congestion and post nasal drip irritating my throat constantly. I finally figured it out that it had to be the olmesartan when I read the reviews about its side effects now I am going to consult with my fp about a new medication that will work without the terrible side effects I have experienced.

Benicar (olmesartan):I was put on Benicar as an additional BP medication due to a Vitamin B Deficiency of 2 years. Took 2, yes 2 doses, of 5mg one in A.M. & one at P.M. Suffered from every side effect listed very quickly. Don’t know why they even tried it on me as I have damaged kidneys & a heart condition. It pushed my BP even higher & bad chest pain. Benicar should be outlawed. Was put on Lisinopril 20mg today. I’m one who normally gets the worse of side effects of most medications. This was the worst. Glad I acted quickly.

I husband of 18 years was on this rubbish olmesartan for 6 months and it made him into a lunatic. It took me over 7 months to get him back to the doctor to get his meds changed. Became absolutely bipolar on this medication. It was like he had a demon in his body that would make him hateful to everyone. My husband before this med was laid back and a joy to be around. It had to come down to a now or never declaration to get his attention since he became the leader of the He man's woman haters club. 2 days in to new med and I see the demon fading. This stuff is brutal.  I recommend you personally drag yourself or your spouse kicking and screaming from first week. Praying and wishing isn't going to change anything with this medicine.

My doctor moved me onto Olmesartan after my BP did not respond well enough to the previous drug.  I experienced loose bowels as soon as I started on Olmesartan, but stuck with it as it did a bang up job on getting my BP down and online reviews stated that these symptoms could last a couple to three weeks.  Sure enough, after three weeks, no more problems!  I did communicate with my doctor about the symptoms after a week, but told him that I wanted to stay the course and see if the symptoms would quit quickly.  Glad I stuck it out and love this drug!

Benicar (olmesartan):I was given Benicar 20 mg in Jan 2020 for BP.  I was on it 10 days then was rushed to hospital with severe chest pains and difficulty breathing.  I was kept for "observation" while stress tests were done.  All good thank goodness, but the chest pains remained.  Then I read the "more serious side effects" ... chest pains was #2 !!!  Don't give me a pill that is going to cause more problems and less quality of life!!!

Benicar (olmesartan):Was switched from Losartan to Benicar due to recall of Losartan.   First week was ok, some nausea which was helped with taking with food.  Have been on it about 6 months and have had multiple issues but had not thought related until recently. Awful head fullness in morning, migraines, steady headache most of the day, lower leg pain, not able to sleep, and then filling like my ears are blocked and was treated for middle ear infection several times due to constant ear pain and vertigo, dizziness. Very blurry vision, floaters Finally started looking at all my medications and found that when I moved Benicar to later in day, the nausea, dizziness and fatigue occurred within an hour of taking. It did great at lowering my bp, but side effects are awful! After discussion with doctor and safe Losartan again available I am switching back. This drug is just not for me. Hoping things settled down once it is out of my system.
Update: I did make the switch to Valsartan 320 mg from Olmesartan 40 mg. I am back to normal. I will not be going back to Olmesartan.

My internal medicine Dr. put me on Olmesartan 40 mg and it was working great for my blood pressure. The maker was Accord. I developed restless legs at night so a cardiologist told me to switch to Valsartan 320 mg, It was not working as well as the Olmesartan. (I was drinking a little more than 2 drinks per day. I know that alcohol will and can affect BP. I did not stay on it very long so I really didn't give it a chance) I am back on Olmesartan 40 mg different manufacturer and not drinking. I have ringing in my ears, tinnitus, foggy head and just overall feeling weird, can't really describe it. When that weird feeling comes on I can take a little xanax which makes me feel better. I cannot continue this. Question: has anyone switched from Olmesartan 40 mg to Valsartan 320 mg for similar reasons? Do you feel better?

Benicar (olmesartan):This medicine caused me to have pain in my ankles. 3 doctors didn’t believe that it was the medicine and ordered autoimmune tests which was negative. I finally insisted they change my medicine to Lisinopril. After being on the medicine for a full month after suffering for a year and a half, my ankle pain is gone! So annoyed after wasted money spent on tests and trip to rheumatologist.

Had high blood pressure, yes is fixed that but the PAINS in my legs has increased so much I am distraught. I cannot walk 50 yards, stand for more than a minute, sometimes driving is very uncomfortable. I've been to physio, acupuncture, reflexology etc, etc with no improvement or explanation to why I'm so bad. I used to walk a lot for exercise but haven't in the past two years and now it's time to definitely change from this medication. I have to get my life back from all this unbearable pain..
My blood pressure has been elevated even higher since I began taking this medicine olmesartan.
Just having some roaring in my ears and wondering if this 20 mg daily may contribute to this uncomfortable feeling.

Benicar (olmesartan):Hi! I was diagnosed with high blood pressure (HBP) at the young age of 14, I weighed about 100lbs at the time. I've been taking benicar for about 4 years, previously lisinopril 40 mg. I started 20mg of benicar and blood pressure was not controlled. So I was put on 40mg, I would take it everyday and I would get so tired. So I told a new doctor and she said decrease back to 20mg, so I did and switch my time taking it to bedtime. It puts me to sleep, however after 4 straight nights of it I wake up so drained have no energy and feel a little confused. I too have breathing problems but assumed my asthma was getting worse. I've been asking for a new medicine, with no luck. I'll be honest I hope for the weight gain, I could use some of that but it hasn't happened. Hopefully I can get off of this soon!

I was taking Losartan then Valsartan but when both were recalled my Dr. prescribed Olmesartan 40 mg. My BP was great. I was even thinking about decreasing my dosage. I started having restless legs mainly in my calves. I was playing a lot of golf and walking a lot but noticed the pain was every day and disturbing my sleep. I just switched to Valsartan 320 mg, my leg pain is better. I am in pretty good shape and have decided to really get busy with my diet and exercise to see if I can get off BP medicine all together. I just bought the book Plant Paradox by Dr. Gundry and going to give that a try. Anyone else tried Plant Paradox?

This Olmesartan generic I am going to agree with a lot of you folks IS NOT THE SAME! I have experienced the same as many of your folks switching from Brand to Generic due to insurance policy changes. Everything from an irregular heart beat, breathing, shakes, chills! At times feeling like I'm going to STROKE out! It's garbage, and IT IS NOT THE SAME!

This medicine olmesartan is horrible I took it for 4 months for high blood pressure after my doctor switched me from losartan because it was recalled and I have felt like rubbish the whole time not realizing it was side effects from this medication. I had flu like symptoms, muscle weekness, headaches, dizziness and foggy headed. I was worried it was something much worse. I would not recommend it!

Had really bad experiences with Losartan. Then was given Olmesartan. Still having shortness of breath, now runny nose, joint and spinal pain. Can hardly walk a hundred yards and heart starts to race and can't breath. Severe anxiety follows. ED is bad. I am on medicaid and limited to a research hospital. Doctors unconcerned with drug interactions and side effects. Muscle cramping and fall often. Going to reduce Olmesartan little by little and stop taking it. Very bad experience. Have to take the bus to hospital but the walking distance from the bus stop to the medical center is too far. So I haven't been able to see my cardiologist. Hate this medication!

I didn't realise for a couple of years that the excruciating lower back pain wasn't two bulging disks but this olmesartan drug.I know this for sure because after going off it for a few weeks the pain went away My back felt like a vice was crushing the lower back.

I had been on BP medicine for about 25 years, recently doctor switched me for Olmesartan 20mg manufactured by Aurobindo combined  Amlodipine 5mg by Lupin (this Lupin I don't think it have good quality), I took both in the morning after breakfast I had been on it about 5 1/2 weeks, it worked well bring BP below 120/80 sometimes to 92/60, only side effect I had now is insomnia. I agreed with other posters manufactures made different quality of the drugs, I started request pharmacy refill with the manufacturer that worked for me.

I see some people reporting issues, but not indicating the manufacturer!This is HUGE.  As I reported previously, there are SIGNIFICANT difference between manufacturers of the same medication!!I'm currently on 40mg Olmesartan by Alembic Pharms LTD (US) corp for 2 months and although brings the BP down to where it should be, has SIGNIFICANT side effects - that being tired, taking 3 hour naps after work and brain "floating", unable to concentrate properly with pressure like someone squeezing my temples!  :O  It's basically impossible for me to do my job!I did NOT have these or ANY side effects from REDBROOK (India)-Olmeheal 40mg, so I'm going to find out and get my hands back on this permanently now that I know there is significant differences between manufacturers.  Surprised the US manufacturer SUCKS and India is the best!  Oh well, gotta use what works and with the least/no side effects.  I have to work.

Benicar (olmesartan):I was diagnosed with hypertension at 24 years old. I started benicar HCT then. 12 years later, I am still taking this med and wouldn't take anything else for my BP. It is very well controlled and I feel absolutely relaxed after taking it. They tried to force the generic version which doesn't work. I get regular labs done and I feel just fine!

When Losartan was recalled, my doctor prescribed Olmasartan.  The first thing I noticed was I was extremely tired and wanted to sleep all the time.  I'm usually full of energy.  Next was a loss of appetite, my heart felt like it was racing, I developed a very bad rash, my feet and ankles became swollen.  I have been off of Olmasartan now about two weeks and I'm starting to feel better.  A horrible drug.

Pharmacy changed my manufacturer  of olmesartan to Accord. I had no problem with brand name or 1 generic, but this accord brand  was horrible. Nausea, diarrhea, stomach pains, headache, vertigo, confusion that got worse every day, to the point I had to stop taking it. I hadn't been told the pharmacy changed it, I had to see what I had done differently since I got sick, the medication was it. Now after stopping it 48 hours later I am much better. I will not be taking it again. It didn't reduce my BP enough, though Bextra brand did. I just can't afford it. I have this issue with some brands of Metformin also. Fillers seem to be a problem.

Been on and off HBP meds for ~15 years.  I'm 48YO now and 175lbAfter reviewing daily BP, it appeared the only medication that worked was Benicar HCT....BUT had the WORST side effects (deep muscle aches and in the tendons, lethargic, severe stomach burning) and I could NOT take itI tried Hydrocholorthiazide and Olmesartan AS SEPARATE PILLS to see if it was one or the otherThe 25mg HCT brought it right down from 160/115 to 120/80, but crept back up to where it wasI then tried 40mg Olmsartan taking 1 pill/day at night.  Results....BP 120/80 no significant side effects!  I now have been on this for 3 months and no issueThe problem - was Benicar/HCT and the company!Solution - Olmesartan Medoxomil.  I'm currently on Alembic Pharms LTD (US) corp, have been on from Daiichi Aiichi Sankyo (Japan).  The BEST I've been on is from REDBROOK (India)-Olmeheal 40.  I highly recommend you try to get your pharmacy's to carry this mfg.

54 year old male. Olmesartan medoxomil 40mg one daily caused muscle cramps in my upper back, lower back pain while standing to the  point of having to sit down and dizziness. I stopped taking this med and within four days all of the above problems went away.
Olmesartan lowered blood pressure but chest hurts and feel hung over all the time.  Fall asleep at dinner table. Not worth it for me

I have been on Olmesartan for about a month now and my blood pressure is doing very well so far. I have absolutely no side effects and  seems to have stopped my palpitations !! I’m I’ve read in some reviews it causes them but for some reason helping mine. Anyone else have this happen to them??

Olmesartan has been one of my daily BP meds for about 15 yrs at 40 mg per day.Stopped taking it a week ago cold turkey and feel loads better with no aches and pains or blocked nasal passages and feeling I have flu all the time. I think I have suffered all the side effects possible which have got worst with time. I also take Atenolol, Amlodapine, Doxazosin and am 75 yrs old in June.

Benicar (olmesartan):Benicar should have been recalled in 2013 when the first signs of problems occurred. I see they settled the law suit but what about the ones with the stomach issues or maybe cancer..???

Benicar (olmesartan):Benicar was not a good medication for me. I experienced awful side effects.  Stiffing of the body, very painful joint pain most at night, leg pain, daily stomach pains (thought I had cancer), chest pains, diarrhea, bloating, difficulty in walking, could barely walk a block without getting out of breathe and needed an inhaler,  I had swelling of tongue, face, feet, weight gain and some depression due to dealing with all these issues.  One day after seeing my reflection in a large window at work, I was shocked to see how hunched I was and full off pain.  I was never like this and how did this happen? I started to believe I must be ageing.  I realized the only change in life was this medication and insisted it switched. Once removed the critical side effects stopped except with ongoing digestive issues.

I am 54 Years old male, I have been in an out of hospital for the last 4 years, I have tried I think every drug for high BP. The medicines and doctors  are not perfect as they think they are. I recently did a test to see if it was the olmesartan,  I stopped it cold turkey and like many of you - yes I feel better, but even stranger  is that my bp went down and flu like feelings gone

Benicar (olmesartan):I've been taking benicar 40 mg and amlodipine 5 mg for 2 weeks. BP is slowly dropping but I'm having erection problems...I'm thinking that it is the amlodipine because I've have that problem with it before. Remember guys any diuretic is likely to cause impotence in men so if it has hctz behind it...it's a diuretic. I'm going to just stop taking the amlodipine and see it that works
The olmesartan side effect was I Had inflammation in my throat so that I had to continually suck on cough drops to stop coughing. My head felt like I had a cold and I did not.

62 yr old woman. Took brand name Benicar for several years it did control my BP but I'm very nearly bald, every joint I have is painful, tinnitus....all of this after I began Benicar. My insurance will not cover brand anymore was changed to generic from Alembic Pharma last yr not as good a control as brand but still worked now can't get it & was changed in January to generic from Glenmark Pharm now my lower blood pressure number won't go below 90!

Benicar (olmesartan):Ended up in ER  had taken generic form  Olmesartan 20mgms every night at bed time for 3 weeks.  I felt ok until one early evening I was out felt weak nauseated,  and actually fainted while sitting down first time ever in my life , luckily med staff were near.  I went to ER  and BP recorded very low 60 over.?  Blood work showed kidney function impaired  , very frightening and traumatic for my family to see.

I started Olmesartan 5 days ago after my losartan/hctz was recalled. I took the drug first thing in the morning. By afternoon, I had a significant feeling of tightness around my upper chest/lower neck area.  I woke up during the night with shortness of breath and tightness in my chest. I felt like I couldn’t expand my lungs nor clear the air from them on exhale. I first thought I was having a heart attack, though I had no other symptoms. I immediately sought medical treatment. My heart was fine. I had no other respiratory symptoms such as wheezing or strider which could indicate bronchitis, Asthma, or anaphylactic reaction. When I repeated that I was just started on Olmesartan, the doctor researched it and found that this medication causes bronchospasm as a COMMON side effect. Needless to say, I trashed the bottle. Please make sure you see a doc if you have symptoms like these. Don’t stop your meds, etc.

When I first took this med (olmasartan plus diuretic)  I  was fine.  Now ten yrs older I'm now suffering terrible side effects, painful muscles,  joints skin rash, tinnitus, shaky, trembly feeling, anxiety  and  cramps.  My  doctor doesn't believe me ...and I am afraid to stop taking them

It took 4 years to find the right BP med for me and this one works great. I have been on it for over 8 years now. It is not a common med so the pharmacy has to order it for me which takes a day. My doctor said this is primarily for African Americans which is why it is not a common drug. I don't understand all that but who cares it works for me. Ask your doctor about it if you can't find the right one for you.

Benicar (olmesartan):I've had uncontrolled high blood pressure for years. I was taking or had taken multitudes of meds for it. Diuretics, beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, etc. Finally benicar was tried and wow...normal blood pressure for the 1st time in 20 years! I don't get the side effects like many here either. I'm still taking my diuretics and B-blocker as well, and switched to the generic version of olmesartan (insurance). For me, Benicar (olmesartan) is a miracle drug.

I have been taking Benicar for years and the generic more recently. It does control my BP but the side effects have gotten so much worse over time. Started with a scratchy throat, moved to an irritating cough and now watery frequent bowel movements and a lot of post nasal drip and awful phlegm at night which results in vomiting. I am just now realizing that the diarrhea is probably caused by the rx. My problem is I have tried so many different meds and this is the only one that works and am scared to start all over trying different meds.

I have been taking this for about a month. I started getting  nasal congestion and a ear ache and swelling , I was thinking I just had a sinus infection I tried everything to get rid of it. One day I  missed a dose and I felt better that day and the next day I started taking it again and all of a sudden my symptoms came back  I’m done with this medicine . I’m hope this will help someone else in the future. It’s hard to find you the right one that works for you.

Benicar (olmesartan):Have taken Benicar for 10 years or so.  Blood pressure around 123/70.  When forced by insurance to take generic, now 156/89.  In the past, I got name brand with $42.00 a month co-pay.  In order to get name brand now my co-pay would be around $290.00 a month.  Outrageous!  Switching to something else.

I was put on olmesartan by a fill in doctor 10 years ago. When asked why as my BP was always good. I lost my son so stress was high. Basically I decided as they changed how it is dispensed with the benicar given monthly only and HCT (hydrochlorathiazide) given 90 days. I have been busy after hurricane and had run  out  of the benicar and I noticed a big difference 2 days later and now 6 days later...my pain and fatigue are waning and swelling is going down. I decided to look up risks by stopping, which was just delaying going in for refill of new BP meds. My doctor had told me a few years ago when I asked if I really needed this his response was it is good to take anyway as we get older. That wasn't a good response anyway. I just turned 61. I have daily stressors but reading the side effects on here ...its me in a nutshell. I'm shocked this medication is so harmful.
Reliably moved me from untreated BP of 143/91 to 116/76
Benicar (olmesartan):It help control my blood pressure but the side effects were terrible leg spasms and cramps.

I  stayed on 10mg most of the time. For weeks it worked though I felt brain fog throughout the day, then headaches that intensified over time. I woke up every night abruptly. Depression, blurred vision, cognitive problems, vertigo, loss of equilibrium, lethargy, chest pains, anxiety, stomach aches, brain zaps... It was like being at the gates of death. This drug made my life miserable, and the dr that prescribed it just didn't believe me.  I thought I was dying. One day I decided to skip a dose. The next day all of the symptoms were gone! It's been now five days since I stopped this deadly poison and feel stronger every day. I also realized the company that makes it is dealing with multiple lawsuits about all the harm its caused many people. This is scary stuff. Needless to say I switched drs and threw away this poison. If you are feeling miserable while taking olmesartan, try skipping one day. You will be surprised.Love to all, and hope we can control bp in more natural and healthy ways.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have just turned 66 years old 4/30/18.    I've have been taking Benicar HCT for 6 months. Have been very sick with persistent uncontrollable diarrhea (have it right after eating anything), extreme shortness of breath (so bad that I had a lung scan done...was negative), dizziness (had to stand slowly and in place until stabilized), debilitating fatigue (couldn’t hold out to do anything, taking a bath was so tiring ) muscle/joint pain (hard to walk...walked with limp), nausea (had to take antinausea medication frequently), sleeping problems (couldn’t stay awake and sometimes problems falling asleep and staying asleep), weight gain (approximately 20 pounds in 6 months), and bloating (felt full all the time).  But no more, I stopped taking it on my own without doctor approval after my research of the side effects. Been off for 2 days and remarkable difference.

Benicar (olmesartan):Been on beta blockers, clonidine, lisinipril over the last year.  The beta blockers an I don't get along.  I actually had higher bp over time on them.  Clonidine is super at reducing pressure, but are intolerable daily.  Benicar for me is fantastic.  No side effects and keeps pressure in check at 20mg once a day.  I demanded the real thing as generic beta blockers caused me problems.  I do not trust  generic quality.  So far, Benicar is the best drug I can imagine for blood pressure patients.

I have been taking Benicar for 12 years and was switched to a generic last January, 2017.  I could tell no difference until they switched the generic to Olmesartan in May, 2017.  My blood pressure was up 10-15 points and I experienced light headiness to the point of blacking out twice after taking for 10 days.  My insurance will not pay for Benicar.  I've tried all 5 of the medications my insurance will pay for. My doctor was about to add a third pill to the medication just to control my blood pressure.I'm running out of options.
Even at 40 mg daily dosage the drop in the blood pressure is not significant.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been on Benicar 20/12.5 for 10 years and my blood pressure has been normal 110/65.  I had to switch to the generic be cause of insurance reasons and I experienced all kinds of side effects: dizziness, cough, and higher blood pressure. It is not the same.
Side effect of increased skeletal and muscle aches and pain most noticeable within 4 hours of taking medication

Benicar (olmesartan):Benicar kept my HBP down to normal for years. Aside from fatigue and subsequent weight gain I felt no ill effects as long as I took it at bedtime. However now that the generic form is being pushed by the pharmacies my HBP is back with a vengence. The systolic number went from years at 123 to 190 in 2 months. The worthless generic substitute is Olmesartan Medoxomil! This experience has totally changed my opinion about generic drugs and where they are made. I reported this to the FDA because I was on the verge of having a stroke because of this generic Benicar.

I have taken both Olmesartan (Benicar) and Losartan (generic Angiotensin II receptor antagonists) to replace earlier ACE Inhibitor drugs, which invariably caused a chronic cough for me. I went off Benicar in 2015 because my insurance designated it as non-preferred and it was extremely expensive, but I have recently discovered that it is now available as a generic. Olmesartan has given me better and more stable control of moderately elevated blood pressure than Losartan.

I’m a medical doctor and I was tested to show high BP. I ignored it for many years till I began to get the occasional headache and with a lot of coffee, I would experience near panic attacks. Then I was put on Olmesartan by the cardiologist at 160/110 and within minutes, my blood pressure in under control at a very low dose as I have reazlised that I am exquisitely sensitive to Olemsartan even at 20mg. So I am taking 10 mg Olmesartan with the initial lightheadedness at every dose administration. After 15 minutes the symptoms pass and I am in control for a day and a half. So I have my portable BP instrument with me OMRON and my BP is 120/85 most times though it can fluctuate. But I dose myself every alternate day and It’s GREAT!

Although the Benicar 40 mg has been working well, I'm trying to figure out how to deal with the excessive tiredness. Tried taking it at 8:00 last night, slept very well for 7 hours, but still feeling sleepy this morning

Benicar (olmesartan):I've been on Benicar HCT  20mg/12.5mg for 3 week now this medicine has some bad side effects I've experienced light headed, dizziness, cough feel like my chest feel tight sometime muscle aches tired all the time..does anybody else experience these side effects..when you tell your doctor what your experience they thinks it's not the medicine we know our bodies..

Olmesartan gets my BP down but with downsides  - sometimes systolic and diastolic decrease at different rates and my body has difficulty adjusting back to normal.  I have experienced all of the following side effects:  elevated heart rate,  chest pain, vertigo,  breathlessness during exercise , light headedness. I am looking for an alternative with less side effects. The best advice I can give is that you should first get yourself a good BP monitor. I got myself an OMRON BP652 which is excellent. I chose a wrist monitor because it is small, portable and easy to use. You will benefit by finding your own optimal dosage (40mg/day was way too much for me)Effectiveness  9/10;   Side effects  3/10   Overall  6/10

I have been using Olmesartan for 9 months.I am a 63 year old male with no prior medical history. My lifestyle has always been healthy (intake-wise) but increasingly sedentary and stressful and I think these factors are what exacerbated my BP. Otherwise I was healthy: non-smoker, low alcohol, average weight etc.My wife finally convinced me to get a routine medical check-up  (last check-up approx. 5 or 6 years previously) and the result was the doctor discovered high BP ( Systolic 190, Diastolic I can’t remember – but the message was clear – my BP was dangerously high). So the doctor prescribed Olmetec 40mg, once-daily at bed-time - and arranged a follow up appointment for a fortnight later. I went home and immediately ordered a BP monitor

Benicar (olmesartan):I took Benicar for 12 years or more and went through the leg cramps etc. but it worked well on my BP. I would get kidney infections occasionally but didn't know why. One day a few years ago I came down with painful gout. My new doctor took me off Benicar right away. She said it contributed to my gout flare ups because it affected my kidneys. I was so angry because I didn't know and hadn't read up on it. Have your kidneys check regularly while taking this med. Now through diet and another BP med I do well with the Gout, however I wish I hadn't taken Benicar so long and had it affect my kidneys.  Be careful!

Side effects,  refux, heartburn,  rapid weight gain, dizziness,  generalised osteoarthritis pain, restless legs and leg pain, insomnia,  urinary tract infection,  blurred vision,  tiredness,  silent migraine,  nausea,  heavy legs and body after taking in evening,  aspiration of stomach contents, reflux while asleep scary... Lots of side effects,  going to GP to have change of meds,  feel terrible with all these side effects.. Blood pressure lowered as a result on a positive note...

I started taking this med 15 years ago. Have had to take a reflux tablet too since commencing this but unsure if it was related. All in all has kept my Bp in normal range. Just starting to get slight raises now in Bp after 15 years.

Benicar (olmesartan):I took 20 MG Benicar as an alternative to Lisinopril which caused a cough.  With Benicar, the cough went away after a few weeks but a new side effect took its place: I would wake up in the middle of the night with a sore chest and upper back pain.  Its a shame because during the day, Benicar had no apparent side effect and kept BP at 128/79.

I've had high Bp for 20 years and controlled it with exercise, karate, but finally went to Dr with buzzing in my ears, my Bp was 260/160. Olmetec brought it down to 120/70 in a few days, after a workout my Bp is 90/60. I've been taking it for a month now and feel so relaxed, like chilled out all the time. But arms and legs feel like lead when working out and I tire real easy but I knew taking Bp meds would do this, but at 260/160, that was too risky. Many comments here I agree, sex drive goes to zero, feeling of lethargy but the drug works. I did try coversyl first and that had absolutely no affect on me.

Came across Olmesartan on this site and impressed by its high rating. Had been on Amlodipine and Ramipril, both caused various side effects including frequent urination, cystitis, itchy scalp and very upsetting thinning my hair to the front top of my head. Also facial flushing, pounding head, sleeping badly with vivid dreaming. Apart from not Iowering my blood pressure, 165/80 I seemed to be getting every side effect and was despairing that this was it for the rest of my life. I spoke with my GP who was unaware of Olmesartan, I think due to the fact that its a more expensive drug, she reluctantly prescribed it for me. Its been a month now my BP averages 115 to 125/60 no side effects apart from slight light headedness. Got my life back !

Benicar (olmesartan):Had active life style was able to do 40-50 min tread mill workout (Run/Walk) and was able to participate in outdoor soccer. Lost gf, grandmother died , horrible boss in new job in 3 month  = 189/125 diagnosed accidentallyFirst 20mg (85% effective) , then 40 mg workedBlood pressure: Normal , weight gain 30 pound addedOther impactsCramps while playing soccer. Enhanced sensation of muscle fatigue (post hitting ball) or muscle in body. Next day feel effects. Stopped running / bike- ride rowing okFlaky Rash on elbows dime size /now double (Use moisturizer / Nivea aftershave on it works).Weight gain depression3 hours after taking Meds, lazy Potassium sports drink helped muscle recovery feel good (Doctor say don't take potassium

Benicar (olmesartan):I give this medicine a 5 because it does lower your blood pressure but unfortunately the side effects are pretty bad. I was diagnosed with hypertension at 25 and before benicar I never had a dizzy spell in my life. Now dizzy spells are just part of life as well as fatigue and breathing issues.  It's not all the time but a few times a week I just feel unwell. I think this is a good medicine for an older person who just needs to get the numbers down but it's terrible for a young active person.

Benicar (olmesartan):I was taking a different pill at first but my doctor decided it wasn't working to lower my pressure enough, so they said we are going to try you on this one. I took one the next day since I had already taken my old pill. The first day the pill did lower my blood pressure with no problems. The second day I took it my pressure was still at a good number. I did not later when I tried to sleep I couldn't. Each time I would fall asleep it was hard for me to breath and a few times that I woke up my heart was beating differently and I had some pain in my chest. I won't be taking this medication anymore. I will lower it the natural way by watching what I eat, walking and with God's help I will be just fine.

Benicar (olmesartan):This is the worst medication I have ever taken! It was poison to me! Severe lower back pain so bad had to walk with 2 canes! Thought it was sciatica , had extreme bladder pain, headaches , burning itching feet, severe , constipation , stomach pain so bad I ended up in emergency room! And ended up with upper respitory infection, My primary care took me off this garbage , all symptoms seem to be going away! Just a warning before you take this poison ask questions and read up on it!!!!!

Benicar (olmesartan):Beware!! This med worked well to lower bp, but I have been on 40mg for 3 years now this slowly caused problems I didn't catch on to immediately such as severe pain in feet top and bottom like planter fasciitis extremely painful to walk on. Stiffness in legs like bad arthritis pains woke up so stiff. Possibly caused depression weight gain and lack of sex drive. Fatigue. No energy also was diagnosed with under active thyroid. Also diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. Stopped taking Metformin for 2 weeks now only noticed slight improvement in foot pain. Been off of Benicar for 5 days seeing improvement each day pain in feet going away also stiffness going away I'm 50 y.o female felt like 90 years old body in so much pain.
Benicar (olmesartan):Works perfectly. No side affects at all.
Benicar (olmesartan):I was taking Benicar 40 mg for a couple of months.  I stopped taking it when I had a cold and the BP went up again. Is this normal?

My blood pressure was controlled at 120/80, but... after 18 months on Benicar,  I was diagnosed with ulcerative colitis (not good).  So to remedy the UC, I had to take a drug that cost $8000 per year because doctors did not know at the time that Benicar causes UC in some people.     I think people should be aware of this very BAD side effect before starting Benicar.

Benicar (olmesartan):I was suffering from HB pressure for the last two years ...without Medication ....It got really bad in the last two weeks ,that's when my doctor prescribe me Benicar 20 MG...I have been taking it for three days only and I already fell better. Question???? Is it normal for me to feel so relaxed....I'm 61 years old very active  and work out 4 or 5 days a week

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been taking Diovan HCT for the past 10 years; varying doses as my BP continued to increase with age.  Diovan was giving me debilitating migraines and the weight gain was out of control; even though I am a vegetarian and walk about 3 miles a day.  Life on Diovan was miserable.  Two weeks ago I persuaded my doctor to switch me to Benicar HCT and to start me on the lowest dose.  My BP while on Diovan HCT hovered around 190/102 the highest was 200/105 which was becoming rather common lately.  So my doctor also prescribed Bystolic.  Three hours after taking Benicar HCT, my blood pressure slowly dropped to 133/80.  I am not used to "normal" blood pressure, so I felt like I was drunk.  Quite a nice feeling from such a small pill...LOL.

Benicar (olmesartan):Have been on this medication for 10  years.  Didn't realize that side effects crept up very slowly.  I have an entire list of side effects but the highest on my list are extreme fatigue, trouble breathing, gradual worsening depression and just a massive feeling of unwell.  Besides Benicar, I only take Zantac for GERD issues (which popped up after I began taking Benicar).  I used to be a healthy active man, now I am a sad sick mess.  If I only knew what this medication was doing to me way back then...

Benicar (olmesartan):It made feel like I was drunk all the time the unsteadiness on my feet blurred vision. It also gave me hives. It made me eat constantly and I gained like 25 pounds during the 2 mths I was on it.  My lower legs and ankles swelled up and I couldn't get the swelling to go down and I tried everything About a wk to 2 wks after quitting benicar 300mg the side effects started subsiding my lower legs and ankles took the longest to go down even my eating has gone back to normal but now I have 25 pounds to loose. I hope this helps anyone thinking about taking it. My mother also worked with a women that took it for about a month and it made her pass out at work one day and she quit taking it too. Hope this helps!!!

Benicar (olmesartan):I gained 13 pounds rapidly I was only on the medication for less than a month. I also experienced asthma type symptoms. I am not an overweight person and I am very athletic but was diagnosed with HBP. I stopped taking Benicar and my lungs are back to normal and the weight gained stopped. I know it was the medication because the extra weight went away.

Benicar (olmesartan):Noted that many concerned about the price of Benicar.  Go on their website and you can get a coupon that will reduce the co-pay on your Benicar to no more than $25 per month assuming you have health insurance.
Benicar (olmesartan):I am taking Benicar HCT 40/25 I have NO sex drive and really bad leg cramps if I stretch, I immediately get a Charlie horse.

Benicar (olmesartan):Was previously taking Lisinopril at the highest dosage and still had blood pressure readings of 160/95. Bincar HCT 40/12.5 (Benicar combined with a diuretic called hydrochlorothiazide) is the only drug that has ever gotten my blood pressure fully under control (120/77 at doctor today). I take it with a banana or some orange juice in the morning to ensure my potassium levels don't drop too low. I have no side effects with this pill, other than running to the restroom a bit more during the first couple of days I was taking the medication.

Benicar (olmesartan):Benicar is great.  I have been using it for 4-5 yrs now.  I had an initial period of being light-headed for a few weeks when I first started the medicine, but after that, no problems whatsoever.  Keeps my blood pressure around 115-70.  My bottom figure had been around 95.  Benicar is more expensive than a lot of the other hypertension medicines, but it is well worth it for me.

Benicar (olmesartan):Been taking Benicar/HCT for several years now. It is a very effective antihypertensive in this combination. As they say, nothing in life is free. While it does a great job of lowering my blood pressure, I have experienced several bothersome side effects. These include lightheadedness, dizziness and sleepiness. The later may be due to the potent antihypertensive action of the combination. Tried cutting the pill in half, but since it is not scored, really don't know how much medicine I am getting in the split piece.

Benicar (olmesartan):Benicar is very effective, but has side effects.  It is causing me irritable bowel syndrome and diarrhea. My doctor first put me on Lisinopril, which caused my lungs to feel like they were full of fluid, after having difficulty breathing I stopped that medication.  Then the Dr put me on samples of Benicar and it dropped my blood pressure readings to normal and I didn't notice side effects but the insurance wouldn't approve it.  So they approved losartan, which seems to have no side effects but barely reduced my blood pressure, it worked but not very well.  So they got the insurance to approve Benicar, but after taking it for almost 2 months it has caused me to have irritable bowel syndrome, if I stop taking it, I improve, start taking it it gets worse.
Benicar (olmesartan):Controls blood pressure.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been on Benicar for about a year now and I have to say it has helped my blood pressure. Blood pressure is 120-130 and over 70-75 average. My pressure was not dangerously high but my doctor recommended I go on it since it is in my family history, I am 40.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been taking Benicar 20mg. for 2 1/2 yrs. Dr. switched me from lisinopril hydrochlorothiazide after prostate surgery. My blood pressure has remained in the 120/75 range the whole time. The only side effects I have noticed is a change in my sex drive and leg cramps. The lack of sex drive could be from the surgery, Or the fact that I am almost 72 years young.

Benicar (olmesartan):My blood pressure was high (144/90 -180/110) My doctors tried Alpha and Beta Blockers, Calcium Channel Blockers, Ace Inhibitors, Angiotension II Receptor Blockers, and diuretics. My best pressure was 138/90.  The first week we tried Benicar HCT 40/25, I could tell a big difference. My best pressure was 128/78.  After losing some weight, pressure dropped as well.  116/68. I started feeling extremely dizzy. Broke the pill in half and dizziness improved. Doctor will need to adjust dosage and hopefully will be able to discontinue use by end of year if weight loss continues.  My appointments are now 3 months instead of monthly.  Overall, I am pleased with my progress since I started taking Benicar.

Took this for 7 months started having a swollen tongue after 2 months, then every month until 3 days ago when I had a huge mouth and throat edema. It did lower my blood pressure around 120/80 from 140/100. I was highly recommended to stop it and switch to Hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg for the next 2 months and be assessed later.
Benicar (olmesartan):Good medication!  Keeps my blood pressure in a safe range. Have experienced FEW side effects.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been taking Benicar for four years with no noticeable side effects; keeps my blood pressure at 115/75 easily.  I had experienced negative effects such as leg cramps and severe dizziness with other medicines prior to taking Benicar.  I still monitor other aspects of my life that affect blood pressure - adequate exercise, proper diet, etc., but am happy this medicine is available to "close the gap."
Benicar (olmesartan):Had some eye problems, especially when reading small print or looking at computer too long, my feet also hurt/swelled. Benicar has a particularly strong odor in pill form.
Benicar (olmesartan):No side effect.

Benicar (olmesartan):I've been on Benicar/HCT for a couple of months and feel fine on it-no side effects except I had my blood drawn recently and noticed my lipid profile went up drastically from what it usually is (176-222).This is one of the side effects stated. I'm ALSO a cheese fanatic so I'm going to eliminate it for three months, draw my blood again and see what happens. If is stays the same or goes up, obviously its the medication and I'm going to have to try something else because I refuse to go on ANOTHER medication for a NEW problem that was caused by another medication. I hope its the cheese because I'm happy with Benicar.
Benicar (olmesartan):This is the 4th anti-hypertensive I've tried and I am happy so far.  NO side effects, I feel great! Glad I checked here for reviews before trying this medication.

Benicar (olmesartan):Been on Benicar 40mg for over a year, it keeps my blood pressure down. Only side effect that I am not really sure of, is some more joint pain than usual. But with bad discs in back and neck, who can say for sure?Sad part is, thanks to the cost and loss of job/health insurance, I will have to find something cheaper.

Benicar (olmesartan):My PCP started me on Benicar 20mgs/12.5 HCTZ on November 30th. My blood pressure before I took the medication was 145/84, after that it's 135/83-138/85. So far the only side effect I've had is occasional facial flushing. I'll keep monitoring to see how it goes after a full three months on it.
When I first started on these medicines they worked fine, but 18 months later the medicines are no longer controlling my blood pressure very well at all.

Benicar (olmesartan):I've taken my first dose of Benicar (olmesartan medosomil) 40 mg.  I have felt some atrial fibrillation.  My doctor wants me to try it for two weeks and a follow-up visit in thirty days to treat hypertension 160/110/105.  Previously, I was taking diltiazem 240 mg, that was not lowering my blood pressure. Also, my hair started coming out in large amounts when combed, after only two weeks.

Benicar (olmesartan):I started Benicar two weeks ago for extremely high blood pressure 220/105. After two weeks my blood prezssure is now down to 140/80. I do feel much better. More energy. The only complaint I have are the muscle/leg cramps, aches I get every night. Nothing helps. I am on 40mg of Benicar once a day. I will call my doctor and see if there is any solution for the muscle aches. Otherwise I am very happy with the results.

Benicar (olmesartan):Just started this medication, I am 26/M/in fairly good shape, work out 4 to 5 times a week so I don't really know why my blood pressure is high but anyway. Took my 2nd dose yesterday, jogged this morning at the gym and hit "the wall" HARD. Felt short of breath and chest pain. Maybe this will go away once I get used to the medication. PS. taking 20mg.

Benicar (olmesartan):If you are having problems with Benicar, TRY TAKING YOUR DOSE AT NIGHT BEFORE YOU GO TO BED. It took me almost a year to finally figure it out. Plus, you will sleep much better. Give it some time. Most blood pressure medicines make you pee a lot. THIS IS A GOOD THING. Even if you hate getting up to pee a lot, your body is flushing out the sodium from your body. Make sure you drink enough water throughout the day so you have something to expel. Water is good for you anyway, helps you digest better and helps you lose weight. Ditch the caffeinated drinks, coffee, sodas (diet too).Hope this helps.

Benicar (olmesartan):I've been taking Benicar for about 2 years now.  Every other medicine tended to make my feet and ankles swell badly, but this medicine is great.  My blood pressure is consistently about 110/70 (sometimes lower).  No side effects.  I take it in the mornings and do not have a problem with drowsiness, even though I'm really prone to this side effect with other medicines.  I just wish my insurance covered it on their formulary.  As it is I pay $45/month.  This, in combination with the diabetic medicines and supplies, really takes a toll on my budget.  But I guess the results are worth it.  As a state worker in California, though, I may have to investigate less expensive options soon!
Have been taking Benicar for over a year now. Blood pressure is controlled and I have had no side effects that I can tell.

Benicar (olmesartan):I was first put on lisinopril but it made me cough.  Switched to Benicar and it has worked good. I take a half of 20mg in the mornings.  No side effects to report.  My blood pressure was just a little high and it lowered into normal range.

Benicar (olmesartan):I had been taking Diovan for several years and it worked well, but the cost became prohibitive ($120 month) so my Doctor switched me to Benicar HTZ. Benicar HTZ worked almost too well and my blood pressure frequently was in the 109/50's. After about a month I began noticing a lack of sex drive and then soft erections. I have since switched back to Diovan.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been very pleased with the effectiveness of Benicar 20mg. I started out taking Benicar 20/12.5mg and the 12.5 HCTZ caused dizziness and light-headedness after several days of use. So I requested the plain Benicar 20mgwithout the HCTZ diuretic and I have felt much better, no problems at all. My blood pressure has stayed at 120/78, and often it is even lower. I take it once daily and go about my normal routine.

Benicar (olmesartan):Was put on Benicar 20mg twice a day after suffering a stroke, works great with other meds that I'm taking due to stents.  Tried other blood pressure meds, but none of them works as well as the Benicar

Benicar (olmesartan):I'm taking Benicar 40mg for High Blood Pressure 163/100 on average I'm slightly overweight (47. Benicar has actually reduced my dizziness I had prior to taking blood pressure medicines. I tried water pills but blood pressure got worse. My doctor knows I'm the kind of patient that will stop taking medicines that bother me so she skipped the lisinopril and went straight for the Benicar and I'm glad she did although day 4 now and my blood pressure is 124/58 ...sort of low after being in the 100's a few days ago. Maybe I'll need the 20mg but love the focus and energy I have again and the looser bowels are an additional perk! Knees stopped hurting from arthritis too.
Benicar (olmesartan):Benicar has been very effective at lowering my blood pressure and I've experienced no side effects.  I was worried that it may affect my sex drive but it hasn't.
Benicar (olmesartan):Suffered most of the side effects.
Benicar (olmesartan):I have been taking Benicar for about 6 months now and all I can say is WOW! My blood pressure is 124/80 and, needless to say, I'm very happy. So far, no side effects either.

Dry, hacking cough! It took about a year for this side effect to develop, and about 6 months to realize it was the Benicar. I should have known, as Lisinopril and Diovan made me cough previously. I had taken Hyzaar for 2 years, but had to switch because of insurance issues. I did not have the coughing with Hyzaar.

Benicar (olmesartan):Switched over to Benicar from lisinopril (which caused horrendous body jolting chronic cough) Cough has disappeared, blood pressure averages 116/74 to 124/80 maximum. Feel great, mild sleepiness by end of day - a plus - could not sleep well before, also constipation has disappeared. Cramping in legs below knees at night...somewhat like side effects of statin. Will check with doctor..this is my 2nd week of Benicar..took lisinopril for a month. Hope this continues to work. If I miss a dose I become keenly aware. Seems to take effect within an hour. I feel much better and blood pressure readily stabilizes.

Benicar (olmesartan):As of today, it's two weeks since I started taking Benicar 40/12.5mg.  Wow, what an experience.  I don't take any other medicines for ANYTHING.  I do take vitamins and supplements. My blood pressure now is so great that it helps me deal with the side effects better. I have lightheadedness, spontaneous increase in heart beats, light muscle aches all of these I didn't have before taking Benicar.  It took at least a week and a half for my system to adjust.  I'll continue on with it and hopefully after significant weight loss I will come off altogether.  Until then, I'll take the 123/75 blood pressure any day!
Benicar (olmesartan):Very quickly effective in lowering blood pressure. Seems to have few side effects.

On April 19, I went to see my Doctor for flu symptoms.  He told me my blood pressure was 180/110.  I also weighed 389 lbs.  I left with medicines only for the flu symptoms.  I was determined to tackle the blood pressure issue.  I started exercising and eating healthy (not a diet).  A month later, I had dropped 16 lbs and 18 points on my blood pressure; however, the Doctor put me on Benicar (20 mg).  It's been a week and about the only side effect has been feeling light headed.  Some mornings I also feel sluggish.  My pressure has gone down to 148/94.  Although I have a way to go, I lost another 4 lbs in this week.  The medicine is better than I anticipated but I will keep going and soon hope to be off of it.

Benicar (olmesartan):I tried some others before getting this one and though they were effective, experienced a variety of side-effects. This one worked well from the start without any side effects! Love it!

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been on Benicar 20mg for about 2 years for high blood pressure and headaches caused by stenosis and a bad disk in my neck. I know within a couple of hours if I have missed my dose. My blood pressure elevates, headaches with loss of balance, dizziness, sensitivity to light and my neck muscles knot up. For the past several months I have experienced leg and feet swelling on a regular basis. If it wasn't for Benicar, I would have had neck surgery several years ago.

Benicar (olmesartan):Once accustomed to Benicar 20 mg., I love it.  After trying Lisinopril for just one day, I kissed the bottle of Benicar!  But best of all, my arthritis pain in my knees has gone away - an amazing bonus.

Benicar (olmesartan):I've been taking Benicar HCT 40/25 for a couple of years my blood pressure has gone down. Then I started having trouble with some side effects rapid heartbeat and some thyroid issues.

Benicar (olmesartan):Have been using Benicar 20mg for a couple of years now (age 47). Slight dizziness first week after hard exercise in sun (bike riding up steep hill, singles tennis in 85 degree sun). Doctor suggested taking at night before bedtime. Now no problems. Was 140 /95 . Now 122/70 still exercising (tennis, biking) 3-4 days per week without dizziness. Feels like no side effects. Love it.

Olmesartan Medoxomil 20 Mg (Olmighty 20 of M/s Merck) has been really useful.  I had it (10 Mg) for 20 days my blood pressure has reduced to 110/70, I had discontinued, but my blood pressure went up again.
Benicar (olmesartan):I just started taking this medicine, and it makes me dizzy.

Benicar (olmesartan):My doctor put me on Benicar HCT about 7 years ago. I was the type of person who hated to take medication so I didn't take it consistently. I think that is why I finally realized every time I would take a pill I would wake up during the night with severe leg cramps. I told my doctor about it and he changed my prescription to plain Benicar. After that I take it regularly and have no side effects or problems at all and it keeps my blood pressure level at 110/70.

Benicar (olmesartan):I've been taking Benicar 20mg/12.5 HCT for about 7 years and it works great. It keeps my blood pressure down to 120-125/75-80.  I do experience dizziness and light-headiness frequently but I sit at a desk most of the day at work so it's no big deal. I also cannot stay out in the sun long at all. I don't know if this is a side effect of Benicar but also 2 years ago I started getting vision "Floaters" and had to change to another prescription twice. I'm only 43 and my vision is no longer 20/20 and can only get 20/40 with corrective lenses. Eye doctor doesn't see anything wrong and says 20/40 is okay. I'll get a 2nd opinion just in case. Also I started getting flushing or "red face and neck" about 3 years ago. It comes and goes. Benicar is the only medicine I use.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been using Benicar for about a year now and it is great. It is one of those medicines that I can't TELL I'm taking. No real side effects, I was taking it at night before I went to bed but I was waking up to go to the bathroom a lot. Now I take it mid morning and I still have to go to the bathroom a lot but at least it isn't waking me up. On the days I forget I realize it because I'm not going to the bathroom 1/2 as much as when I do. For whatever that's worth. Great medication though and glad I started after being very resistant about going to the doctor.

Benicar (olmesartan):I had been using Benicar with good results except an occasional headache and lightheadedness upon getting up quickly. Because of the high price, I asked my doctor to prescribe a cheaper product - Lisinopril. I have only been on it a short time but have experienced so many side effects that I'm asking to go back on Benicar - high cost or not.
Benicar (olmesartan):I have used Benicar for 8 years with no side effect. Very very satisfied. Blood pressure has been at a constant 125/82.

Benicar (olmesartan):Seems to work for everyone but me.  Quality of life was seriously affected by the on-going dizziness from this product (20mg). Elevators left me weak-kneed and staggering at work. Daily descending stairs also a vertigo nightmare. Blood pressure can easily go into 214/105s in emergencies, so I would like to find something to reduce those numbers, without the extreme dizziness. I work in a psychiatric setting, so I have to be alert and to move quickly without falling on my face. I didn't notice any appreciable drop in blood pressure either, with numbers still in the 170s most of the time.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been taking Benicar 40 mg for about 4 years. Dizziness is the only occasional trouble. Never had any problems associated with drinking alcohol even after some all-night vodka binges - no hangovers either. That was some years ago. I don't drink much nowadays. Blood pressure alternates but is never above 130/80. Interestingly, after running 7 miles (I do it once a week or so) systolic count is often below 110 and diastolic in the low sixties within 5 minutes of the run. I am 56. I am thinking of lowering to 20mg.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been on Benicar HCT for 2 years after being diagnosed with high blood pressure at 23. Side effects were dizziness, constant sleepiness, and weird heart beats, but it works amazingly. After dropping some weight I have just been dropped down just to regular Benicar and have no complaints. Awesome stuff. Now if they could only make it taste better.

I started taking Benicar once daily last summer after being diagnosed with High Blood Pressure.  I am 100 lbs overweight and this trip to the doctor for HBP began my quest for weight loss surgery.  Benicar was working okay initially but cardiologist finally put me on Benicar HCT to help with the water retention. BEST CHOICE EVER!  I couldn't believe how great I felt.  Felt like a 20 something year old again.  Had my lap band surgery in January and now I'm down 40 lbs since last summer and guess what? No more Benicar HCT.  However I do carry it with me per my cardiologist's advice if I experience any further HBP problems. I highly recommend Benicar HCT.  Have told my brothers and my mother to all ask their doctors about it.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been taking Benicar 20mg for about three months. I am about 45 lbs overweight and 37 years old. The medication is working very well, my readings are at 120/80 daily, sustained. I do not watch what foods I eat or drink that much, and I also don't take any other medicines. Excellent product for me!

Benicar (olmesartan):I see many people have had a very positive effect on their blood pressure. I have been using Benicar HCT for about 2 weeks along with Toprol XL. While the Toprol seems to do it's job (reduce pulse rate), Benicar HCT seems to have no effect. I had changed from Norvasc because of swelling and blood pressure was ~140/80, still uncontrolled. Now it's 160/85. My doctor tells me not to worry, everything will be just fine.
Benicar (olmesartan):Not compatible with moderate alcohol. I haven't had a hangover in over 10 years. After two pills, I had a doozy.
Benicar (olmesartan):I have been using Benicar for 1 week. So far the only side effect I have had with Benicar is excessive thirst. My blood pressure is now 113/75.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been taking Benicar 20/12.5 Hydrochlorothiazide for 7 years now. It works well and keeps my blood pressure at 120/75-80. Regular Benicar without diuretic did not work so well so I switched to HCT about 6 years ago. I do experience dizziness occasionally and get light headed but I was told that's normal.

Benicar (olmesartan):Started on Benicar 7 days ago after 3 years on Cardizem Dl 360. So far my blood pressure has not responded well especially my diastolic. I am a nurse so I take my blood pressure daily. I have a history of intolerance to drugs and have to change medications freguently.
Benicar (olmesartan):Benicar is also useful in helping to prevent the natural buildup of Vitamin D in the body, for patients suffering the symptoms of sarcoidosis.

Benicar (olmesartan):I am 47 and slightly overweight. I started Benicar 20mg (first BP medicine) 3 weeks ago for mild hypertension (145/90). The drug hasn't done much to date. My blood pressure now averages 135/80 during the day, but still is around 140/85 in the morning). No side effects accept I recently started having rapid heartbeat episodes, mostly during my 30 minute workouts on the elliptical machine. Sometimes I also experience these in the middle of the night. Don't remember having these issues prior to Benicar.

Benicar (olmesartan):I was asked to try Benicar and to stop taking Clonidine. That was the best move my Doctor made. I feel 100% better and my pressure is also 100% better. Thanks to the maker of Benicar.
Benicar (olmesartan):Perfect for my condition- HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been using Benicar for six years at 20 mg once per day and I have very good readings.  I also do not have the side effects I was getting using a dueretic type BP medicine. Never again will I use one of those.  Benicar was a God send for me as I am allergic to Ace Inhibitors.
Benicar (olmesartan):Keeps my blood pressure down but for me, the best benefit is it has helped with my bowels. Every other medication I've had is constipating. This has normalized me.
Benicar (olmesartan):Felt great 2 hours after starting benicar, only had pre-hypretension but I needed something to help lower pressure. I hope I continue to feel as good as I do now.
Benicar (olmesartan):Has been effective, and with no remarkable side effects.

Benicar (olmesartan):Am on Benicar 40mg once a day. It works pretty good, although doctor had to add 25mg HCTZ to get my blood pressure to 120/70. Causes minimal dizziness, not aware of any other side effects. Prior medicines included lisinopril which worked better but caused me to cough all the time, and Toprol XL. One thing about Benicar - it sped up my heart rate by about 20 beats, which my doctor said was OK.

Benicar (olmesartan):Started Benicar HCT 20/12.5 Sunday morning, Monday evening Blood Pressure was up, took second tablet that evening. Then took 1 morning and 1 evening. Friday morning woke up and walked downstairs with no aches or pains (morning walk has been painful for last 20 years). I hope this trend continues. Peeing every 90 mins, otherwise no side effects.

Benicar (olmesartan):I love this stuff. Works like a charm for someone with hypertension. There are no side effects for me. Also had no migraines while on this one which many others have caused. Great energy and overall condition while taking it.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been using this medicine for almost 2 years with no side effects, which I am prone to from drugs, because of multiple organ issues.  I take it at night which keeps me from worrying about getting drowsy during the day.
Benicar (olmesartan):20mg a day has been enough to put me well into the safety zone.  I haven't had any side effects, except occasional dizziness when standing.  Energy level is great.

My wife tried Benicar once a day and her BP came up after 1 hour. Her doctor advised her to take Benicar twice a day (once in the morning and once at night). Now it has got her BP under control, however the Insurance Companby refuses to pay for it twice a day, saying it has no effect. We have proof that in her case it does.We challeged their refusal to no effect.

Benicar (olmesartan):high blood pressure runs in my family and i've had it since i was very young. we never realized it and i could've had a heart attack if it weren't for this drug. after a while my body got used to 10 mg so it was increased to 15, either way it works like a charm. i have so much more energy and migraines are at a minimum.

Benicar (olmesartan):BP dropped over 100 pts for systolic and diastolic pressures after ONE dose of 20/12.5 Benicar HCT. No side effects at all. Has remained below 120/78 for a week at two daily dosages of 20/12.5 AM and PM. Shortness of breath is gone, all leg and feet swelling is gone, and no increase in frequency of urination. Absolutely no  side effects and BP taken twice a day, AM and PM is around 113/63.

Benicar (olmesartan):I have been on Benicar for quite some time for pulminary hypertension.  I have none of the symptoms listed below nor do I have any negative side effects.  I take 20mg twice a day.  It has really helped to lower my blood pressure.

Benicar (olmesartan):My 65-yr-old-Darling-Husband takes Benicar for HTN; and even though I'm an RN, didn't know what would happen to a person taking Benicar who becomes "run down" Twice after "burning the candle at both ends" my DH had episodes of profuse sweating, a non-palpable pulse, and passed out v-low BP. Cardiologist finally said Benicar can cause zero BP.
Benicar (olmesartan):I have been troubled with "vision floaters" for several weeks now and I am on Benicar. It may be just a coincidence, but the eye doctor has not found another cause.
Benicar (olmesartan):Does anyone on Benicar experience "vision floaters"?
